newsitem.title: ITALY: Some 1,200 troops to land in Albania Tuesday - Italy.
newsitem.headline: Some 1,200 troops to land in Albania Tuesday - Italy.

text.p: Nearly 1,200 Italian, French and Spanish troops will land in Albania on Tuesday at the start of an Italian-led security mission to the Balkan country, Italy said on Monday.
"D-day is tomorrow. It starts from after midnight," Admiral Guido Venturoni, Italy's Defence Chief of Staff, told a news conference.

Venturoni said four Navy vessels would dock on Tuesday in the main Albanian port of Durres with 450 French, 350 Spanish and 200 Italian soldiers after a journey across the Adriatic from the southeast Italian port of Brindisi.
A further 150 Italian paratroopers would land at Tirana airport on board six Italian military aircraft, Venturoni said.
He said the force, expected to number 6,000 when fully deployed, would have up to 2,500 men in Albania within the first ten days of its mission.

The eight-nation force is being deployed with U.N. Security Council approval to protect relief deliveries to Albania, Europe's poorest country, after order collapsed last month in an armed uprising following the failure of fraudulent savings schemes.
